intro: Tetranthera velutina, commonly known as the velvet tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that are often overlooked. Tetranthera velutina is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
